meanings.sent1: The car will wheech down the road.
meanings.sent2: She wheeched past me on her bike.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel wheeched across the yard, trying to catch the bird.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to wheech by as we enjoyed the sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the leaves wheech around in circles.

meanings.sent1: With a wheech, the ball flew into the goal.
meanings.sent2: I heard a wheech as the bird took off into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The wheech of the cheetah's sprint was impressive.
meanings.sent4: The wheech of the roller coaster was exhilarating.
meanings.sent5: The wheech of the arrow hitting the target was satisfying.

meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched whistling sound.
meanings.sent1: The kettle began to wheech on the stove.
meanings.sent2: The wind made the branches wheech outside.
meanings.sent3: The teapot started to wheech loudly, startling everyone.
meanings.sent4: The train wheels began to wheech as the train picked up speed.
meanings.sent5: The cat made the toy wheech across the floor with its paw.
